channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Melissa Hortman, Minnesota Lawmaker Killed in Shooting, Is Remembered by Colleagues
item.description: Colleagues described Representative Melissa Hortman as a skilled, conciliatory lawmaker who was at once steely and warm.

item.title: Where Europe’s most powerful are taking their yachts this year
item.description: Here’s where Europe’s senior executives and C-suite of the Fortune 500 will be vacationing on yachts this summer.

item.title: Poppi founder Allison Ellsworth went from making soda in her kitchen to selling her company to PepsiCo for $1.95 billion
item.description: Having PepsiCo help power the brand's growth feels like having "a Ferrari underneath us" says Poppi's cofounder.

item.title: Nonprofit run by former CEO Anne Wojcicki wins bid to acquire 23andMe
At Least 5 Dead in West Virginia Flash Flooding
item.description: Four inches of rain fell in a 30-minute period in Ohio County on Saturday. One of the victims was 3 years old.

item.title: France’s Macron Faces Dilemma With Intention to Recognize Palestinian State
item.description: The French-Israeli relationship has always been turbulent, but the prospect that President Emmanuel Macron may recognize a Palestinian state has broug...

item.title: Terry Moran Says He Doesn’t Regret Posts Criticizing Trump Administration
item.description: In his first interview since losing his job at ABC News, the longtime TV correspondent, newly popular on Substack, says he does not regret his social ...

item.title: Why reviving U.S. tech manufacturing is harder than you think
item.description: Trump’s wrecking ball to global trade has already proved too fast and too disruptive to encourage companies like Apple to quickly move their productio...

item.title: Inside the rise of Whatnot, the wildly-entertaining, FOMO-inducing, $5 billion shopping app you’ve never heard of
item.description: Whatnot has built a $5 billion business that's equal parts eBay and Twitch. Can it last?

item.title: Business Lobbyists Scramble to Kill $100 Billion ‘Revenge Tax’
item.description: Critics contend that the measure will scare off the foreign investment that President Trump wants to attract.

item.title: France’s Macron Faces Dilemma With Intention to Recognize Palestinian State
item.description: The French-Israeli relationship has always been turbulent, but the prospect that President Emmanuel Macron may recognize a Palestinian state has broug...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Attacked Headquarters of Powerful Iranian Military Unit
item.description: Israel’s military said it had struck the headquarters of the elite Quds Force. The claim, which could not be immediately confirmed, came as Iranian mi...

item.title: Walls Are Put Up Walls Around Israeli Displays at French Weapons Show
item.description: Israel called the move “outrageous.” A French official said Israeli companies were defying an agreement not to display so-called offensive weapons.

item.title: What Is Iran’s Quds Force?
item.description: The group is one of the most powerful and shadowy arms of Iran’s military, and it has long been on the front line of a shadow conflict with Israel.

item.title: Stocks Trade Cautiously as Investors Watch Oil Prices
item.description: As Israel and Iran exchanged more attacks, stock markets mostly rose even as worries remained about possible oil supply interruptions.
